item.title: Liverpool stripped of Unesco World Heritage status
item.description: The city is deleted from the much-coveted Unesco list because of developments on the waterfront.

item.title: NHS workers in England offered 3% pay rise
item.description: Nurses and other NHS workers will get the award "in recognition of the unique impact of pandemic" on staff.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Andrew Dymock jailed for terror and hate crimes
item.description: Andrew Dymock promoted a "distorted and wicked cause" and chose a path of "hatred and bigotry".

item.title: The Smithy Family: Police urge public not to investigate TikTok house arson
item.description: Nick Smith said his family could have been killed when their house caught fire in a suspected arson.

item.title: Jordan Banks: Stepdad saw boy hit by lightning, inquest hears
item.description: Jordan Banks, nine, died due to an "extremely rare" lightning strike during football training.

item.title: Police officers stabbed at West Bromwich shopping centre
item.description: The officers receive "slash injuries" in the attack at the New Square centre, in West Bromwich.

item.title: Seal gets into back garden in Lincolnshire
item.description: The amphibious mammal, known as Dandy, is returned to the water after her dry land diversion.

item.title: Self-isolation hits bin collections across country
item.description: Campaigners are worried fly-tipping will increase as people struggle to get rid of waste.

item.title: Marcus Rashford defends charity deals over profit claims
item.description: The England striker asks why footballers "can't just do the right thing" for charity.

item.title: Judith Fox: Daughter seen buying knives before nurse's killing
item.description: Lucy Fox is on trial after her mum Judith disappeared from her Shropshire home last summer.

item.title: Couple warned over sunbathing close to Mundesley cliff edge
item.description: A coastguard team advises the pair to "find a more suitable place" to enjoy the weather.

item.title: Medals of Princess Margaret's fiance Peter Townsend sell for £260,000
item.description: Gp Cptn Peter Townsend's medals received "much interest", auctioneers say.

item.title: Peterborough Lido: What has the easing of restrictions meant for visitors?
item.description: How has the easing of restrictions affected the summer plans of people at a popular outdoor pool?

item.title: Latitude 2021: What being a Covid test event means for the festival
item.description: The festival in Suffolk will be the first major event following the lifting of most restrictions.

item.title: Covid: Sutton Coldfield restaurant 'lost £100k' due to isolating staff
item.description: Owner Claire Brough said it should have been the "perfect time" for them when Covid rules relaxed.

item.title: Covid rules from 19 July: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: 'Day After Tomorrow' hail hits East of England
item.description: Social media users post videos of huge hailstones falling from the sky.

item.title: Hospital cleaner: 'Nobody says thank you'
item.description: Ernesta has been campaigning for better pay and conditions for cleaners during the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: Royal Blackburn Hospital facing huge pressures
item.description: Royal Blackburn Hospital staff say they are feeling the pressure due to a rise in Covid cases.

item.title: Manchester author achieves dream thanks to literacy classes
item.description: Karen Woods was illiterate at 39 but has now published 21 novels and teaches creative writing.

item.title: Thunderstorms hit after hot spell
item.description: The Met Office has issued an amber warning for thunderstorms.

item.title: Euros 2020: Pair charged with helping fans break into Wembley
item.description: Two 18-year-olds are accused of stealing items which would allow people into the Euros final.

item.title: Staffordshire surgery delayed due to Covid numbers and isolating
item.description: A trust postpones some operations due to a rise in patients with Covid-19 and staff isolating.

item.title: River Trent: Body of 15-year-old boy recovered near Swarkestone
item.description: Police and fire teams were called to a stretch of the River Trent near Swarkestone on Tuesday.

item.title: England heatwave: Giant hail in Leicestershire damages cars
item.description: Golf ball-sized hail comes "thundering down" as the extreme heat warning for England continues.

item.title: Families with disabled children 'face blame culture' when seeking help
item.description: A report finds families seeking help often have to contend with assumptions they are at fault.

item.title: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: White's brace hands Team GB opening win
item.description: Team GB started their Olympic campaign successfully as the women's football side comfortably beat Chile in an empty stadium in Sapporo, Japan.

item.title: Swindon fans 'have club back' - new owner Morfuni
item.description: New Swindon owner Clem Morfuni says fans "have got their club back" as his takeover of the League Two club nears completion.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: British medal hope Amber Hill withdraws after testing positive for Covid-19
item.description: British medal hope Amber Hill withdraws from the women's skeet competition at this summer's Olympics after testing positive for Covid-19.
